Trial_Design.evidence: In a prospective, randomized, controlled design

Intervention.evidence: patients undergoing gastroscopy were assigned to either an intervention group (enhanced preoxygenation) or a nonintervention group (standard care)

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the efficacy of an enhanced preoxygenation protocol for mitigating hypoxemia during propofol sedation during gastroscopy.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the incidence of hypoxemia, defined as a peripheral oxygen saturation level of less than 90% at any point during the gastroscopy procedure.

Result_Outcome.evidence: the intervention group had a significantly lower incidence of hypoxemia

Harms.evidence: No significant adverse events were observed during the procedure.
